original_title: Damn Fine Coffee Roasters recognized as 2nd Best Coffee Processor by Department of Export Agriculture
original_body_lines: Damn Fine Coffee Roasters, a homegrown coffee roaster and processor under the umbrella of Aberdeen Holdings, secured second place at the All-island Best Coffee Processor Awards during Coffee Day 2023, an event organized by the Department of Export Agriculture. The ceremony, aimed at spotlighting diverse coffee varieties and advocating sustainable practices, highlighted Damn Fine Coffee Roasters’ exceptional commitment to producing premium-quality Sri Lankan coffee.

Renowned for its sustainably sourced, hand-picked beans and state-of-the-art processing techniques, the company boasts an array of products—four distinct bean varieties, three ground coffee types, six unique coffee capsules, and convenient French Press sachets—all crafted to perfection for an exquisite coffee experience. This extensive range caters not only to individual coffee lovers but also to hotels, cafes, restaurants, and corporate clients, showcasing the brand’s versatility and dedication to excellence.

Damn Fine Coffee Roasters’ relentless dedication to reviving Sri Lanka’s coffee heritage through collaboration with artisan farmers has resulted in the resurrection of legendary flavors infused with a modern vibrancy. Commended by the Department of Export Agriculture for their consistent delivery of superior coffee, the company remains a proud advocate for the distinctiveness and quality of Sri Lankan coffee. As a member of Aberdeen Holdings, Damn Fine Coffee Roasters contributes significantly to the conglomerate’s success, standing as a beacon of excellence in Sri Lanka’s coffee industry.
